TopicTitle: So, what's everybody playing right now?

Articles.Content: Just post whatever game you're currently playing here.
He posted on a forum primarily accessible by browsers.

Currently I'm playing a lot of Assetto Corsa.

http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x1hdkld_assetto-corsa-four-good-laps_videogames

Pebble, I'm like you, but I'm driving even real-er:

DUN

DUN DUN

It's on sale 75% off, usually 64 dollars!
I've been playing Turbo Dismount these days:
I'm on KSP only occasionally now and waiting for the asteroid patch and 0.24 before really getting back into things. I've just discovered WoW so I'm playing that quite a lot at the moment.

I'm on KSP only occasionally now and waiting for the asteroid patch and 0.24 before really getting back into things. I've just discovered WoW so I'm playing that quite a lot at the moment.

So I guess your first name isn't Leroy, seeing as you just discovered WoW. (

)
Pebble, I'm like you, but I'm driving even real-er:

DUN DUN DUN

(F1 2013 pic here)

It's on sale 75% off, usually 64 dollars!

Yeah, since F1 2013's under $20 I think I'll buy that. I gave it a test drive Friday and rather liked it, even if the UI is bloatatious. (Do I REALLY need to wait for the game to load a virtual mechanics bay with animated characters on the dark side of the Uncanny Valley? More zoom-zoom, less load-load!)

But really, Destroyer, you ought to try Assetto Corsa. It's great.

Edited March 16, 2014 by pebble_garden
Hearts of Iron III
Playing a little bit of the original Homeworld to get ready for this: http://www.homeworldremastered.com/
Google picture war reloaded

Banished and Plague Inc..

With one hand, I give life..and the other I take it away.
I've been getting into Dark Souls lately, beat it in 58 hours with my first character, and I'm almost finished it with my second character now (at 40 hours).
KSP, forum games.. but not today..

So I guess your first name isn't Leroy, seeing as you just discovered WoW. (
)

Yeah, since F1 2013's under $20 I think I'll buy that. I gave it a test drive Friday and rather liked it, even if the UI is bloatatious. (Do I REALLY need to wait for the game to load a virtual mechanics bay with animated characters on the dark side of the Uncanny Valley? More zoom-zoom, less load-load!)

But really, Destroyer, you ought to try Assetto Corsa. It's great.

Thinking aboat it. Sale, waiting for a sale.

Well, I have been thinking I want to start learning Unity for the reason of making a new game based entirely on Space: 1999. It would be sandbox. The only knowns are the ability to fly all the ships in the series, and as much or all of the base as possible depicted in ridiculous detail. Lot of man hours.
Spac engineers was the last thing I played . Before that, KSP
Camping the **** out of unaware VS players in Planetside 2
been playing total war Rome 2 waiting for Hannibal at the gates
I've gotten back into TF2, bought premium, and am currently on a scrapbanking spree. Hopefully, I'll be able to buy some hats soon

I think I've turned into a gaming curmudgeon. Still rotating Fallout: New Vegas, Skyrim, Civ 5, and Borderlands 2 with KSP. I've not seen anything recently besides KSP that doesn't seem like Shooter X: Been There and Done That.
Occasionally KSP, sometimes something else, and sometimes nothing else (and rarely pressing the record button and babysitting my recorders/players/editors)...
Mini Metro.

KSP, of course I think the last time I played anything other than it was around New year-ish, when we were:

Camping the **** out of unaware VS NC players in Planetside 2
Loyalty until death! Strength in unity!

Arma 2 Editor and Notepad++

Sometimes solitaire.

Playing a little bit of the original Homeworld to get ready for this: http://www.homeworldremastered.com/

That's awesome, I loved the Homeworld series and will enjoy a version with updated graphics. Though since playing KSP I think I'll be disappointed by the inertialess, straight-line motion of the ships.
